net.proteusframework.form.registration

Class ExtraValueRegistration

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.form.registration.FormElementRegistration<T>
      • net.proteusframework.form.registration.AbstractFormElementRegistration<com.i2rd.componentfactory.factory.ExtraValueComponentFactory>
        • net.proteusframework.form.registration.ExtraValueRegistration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OptionallyLocalizedNamedObject, InitializingBean

    public class ExtraValueRegistration
extends AbstractFormElementRegistration<com.i2rd.componentfactory.factory.ExtraValueComponentFactory>
implements InitializingBean
    Registration for ExtraValueComponentFactory. To use with Spring: A Spring singleton of this class is expected to exist for each Extra / ExtraValueRendererConfig pair. To add a new form element based on an extra one needs to create an ExtraEditor subclass to edit the configuration specific values and then register an object of this class in Spring. To use in a script: implement ScriptedFormExtra and configure a library with the script. That script interface provides the subclass ScriptExtraValueRegistration.
    Author:
    Pat Double (double@i2rd.com)
